longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Holders of Hong Kong (SAR China) and
Macao (SAR China) passports. 
Visa required, except for Nationals of China (People's Rep.)
accompanying a Minister on an official visit: 
 - applicable to holders of normal passports endorsed "For
   Public Affairs". 
Visa required, except for Holders of a valid "C" visa issued
by the United Kingdom (SEE NOTE 44436) (SEE NOTE 56994) to
holders of China (People's Rep.) passports, if they have first
entered the United Kingdom, for a max. stay of 90 days, or
until the end of the period of stay granted in the United
Kingdom, whichever is shorter. 
    NOTE 44436: For those arriving in the United Kingdom (UK),
   including  
    NOTE 56994: Not applicable to "C" visas issued for the
   purpose of transit, marriage or to enter into a civil
   partnership.
Visa required, except for Holders of a valid "C" visa endorsed
"BIVS" issued by the United Kingdom (SEE NOTE 57023) to
nationals of China (People's Rep.), if they have first entered
the United Kingdom, for a max. stay of 90 days, or until the
end of the period of stay granted in the United Kingdom,
whichever is shorter. 
    NOTE 57023: For those arriving in the United Kingdom (UK),
   including 
Minors:
- Children up to/incl.16 years of age
  
- A separate visa is required for children up to/incl. 16
  years of age if  
- Visas issued to minors (persons under 18 years of age), with
  a date of issue after 12 October 2014,
   
Additional Information:
- Visitors holding passports containing a British inadmissible
  stamp could be refused entry.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry.
